DailyForecast.OverallDescriptionEnglish: The high-pressure system from China still covers upper Thailand and the South China Sea with cool in the morning in the upper country. 1-2 Â°C decrease in the North and a slightly decrease in temperature in the Northeast. At the same time, the westerly trough from Myanmar move pass the upper North isolated rains in the upper North, the lower Central and the East regions. People in the areas should keep healthy due to changeable weather and farmer should prepare for crop's damage. The monsoon trough lies across the lower South into the low-pressure cell over the lower South China Sea while the northeast monsoon prevails over the upper Gulf and the upper South with isolated heavy to very heavy rains in the South. People in the areas should beware of heavy to very heavy rains and accumulation that may cause flash floods and overflows, especially in the foothills near the waterways and the lowland areas. The moderate wind and waves in the Gulf are likely 1-2 meters high while the waves in the Andaman Sea are likely about 1 meter high and above 2 meters high in thundershowers. All ships should proceed with caution and keep off thundershowers.In addition, the typhoon â€œYINXINGâ€ over the upper South China Sea is forecast to move near Hainan, China and the coast of middle Vietnam during 11 â€“ 12 Nov. This typhoon will not move to Thailand and it is expected to downgrade to the tropical storm near the coast of Vietnam. The travelers should check the weather forecast for the region you're going to be visiting.
